name: Stephenauriemma
body:
### Welcome to GitHub Pages.
This automatic page generator is the easiest way to create beautiful pages for all of your projects. Author your page content here [using GitHub Flavored Markdown](https://guides.github.com/features/mastering-markdown/), select a template crafted by a designer, and publish. After your page is generated, you can check out the new `gh-pages` branch locally. If you’re using GitHub Desktop, simply sync your repository and you’ll see the new branch.

### Designer Templates
We’ve crafted some handsome templates for you to use. Go ahead and click 'Continue to layouts' to browse through them. You can easily go back to edit your page before publishing. After publishing your page, you can revisit the page generator and switch to another theme. Your Page content will be preserved.

### Creating pages manually
If you prefer to not use the automatic generator, push a branch named `gh-pages` to your repository to create a page manually. In addition to supporting regular HTML content, GitHub Pages support Jekyll, a simple, blog aware static site generator. Jekyll makes it easy to create site-wide headers and footers without having to copy them across every page. It also offers intelligent blog support and other advanced templating features.

Work Experience:

03/96 – Present 	IBM		Advisory Software Engineer		Littleton, MA	

•	18 years of commercial software development experience.
•	10 years of Java experience including RESTful interfaces and Web Services (Servlet, JSP, AJAX, JSON).
•	5 years of experience with Web 2.0 technologies MVC frameworks (Spring, Struts)
•	3 years of experience with JavaScript using frameworks (Dojo, GridX).
•	Experience with JavaScript using frameworks (Mongo, AngularJS, Express, Node.js, JQuery, Bootstrap).
•	Experience with Eclipse, Git, Perforce and RTC ClearCase.

08/14 – Present IBM Systems Middleware	DataPower 	Web 2.0 Application Developer
•	Development and support for DataPower administrative Web (UI) user interface. IBM DataPower Gateway is a purpose-built security and integration platform for mobile, cloud, application programming interface (API).
•	Tasked with building a new administrative Web UI from an existing product API Manager written with (Mongo, AngularJS, Express, Node.js, JQuery, Bootstrap) managed with a Git repository.
•	Developed new functionality and support to existing administrative Web UIs.

02/12 – 08/14   IBM Business Analytics	OpenPages 	Web 2.0 Application Developer
•	Developed new functionality in the OpenPages software, an enterprise-scale multi-platform commercial J2EE application implemented with WebLogic/Oracle and WebSphere /DB2.
•	Use agile development methods to contribute to the overall design and implementation of a new OpenPages user interface based on DOJO JavaScript components and new backend based on Java AJAX JSON REST services. 
•	Responsibilities include driving the design and development of features in upcoming releases, as well as troubleshooting, debugging, and solving problems in existing releases.

09/10 – 02/12	Lotus Software Group		Domino REST API Service
•	Use agile development methods to contribute to the overall design and implementation of the Domino REST API.
•	Presented at IBM technical conference called Lotusphere in 2012 Session on Domino REST API.
•	Submitted patent CAM8-2011-0323: A method of representing MIME multipart message as JSON.
•	Authored a Chapter on REST Services in the publication "Domino REST Services Extension Library".

01/08 – 09/10	Lotus Software Group		Alloy™ by IBM and SAP
•	Developer (Java) for a Notes 8.0 collaborative software product from IBM and SAP known as Alloy.
•	Designed and implemented Leave Employee and Leave Management scenario for Alloy.
•	Designed and implemented SSO (Single Sign-On) between Domino and SAP solution based on SAML.
•	Designed and implemented a Data Consistency framework for Alloy. 

01/04 – 01/08	Lotus Software Group		Notes  Domino 8.0
•	Developer (C++/ Java ) for Notes 8.0 feature called Composite Applications using Eclipse and Expeditor.
•	Presented at IBM technical conference called Lotusphere in 2007 and 2008.
•	Implemented an extensible synchronization solution based on the SyncML framework and J2EE technology.
•	Received the Invention Achievement Award for my contribution to several synchronization patents.
•	Authored two articles on Composite Application for a popular trade magazine called "The View".
   
03/02 – 01/04 	Lotus Software Group		Domino Offline Services
•	Software Engineer for the Domino Offline Services project, responsible for the development of new features and architecture enhancements for Domino specifically iNotes Access for Outlook.
•	Add offline support for JSP applications by integrating the Jakarta Tomcat Servlet engine into Domino Offline Services  and adding custom JSP tags to existing JSP applications.  

02/00 – 03/02  	IBM Research			Web Technologies
•	Software Engineer for the Apache XML open source project (http://xml.apache.org) developing an XSLT processor for transforming XML documents into HTML, text, or other XML document types.  
•	Developed Xalan (formally known as LotusXSLT) using C++ and Java in a multiple-platform environment based on W3 specifications (http://xml.apache.org/xalan-c). 
•	Designed and implemented a new transformer interface and an XSLT Apache Module. 

01/97 – 02/00 	Notes Programmability	Notes API
•	As a member of the Notes Programmability team my primary function was developing Notes Development Toolkits (API’s) using C, C++, VB/LS and Java in a multiple-platform environment. 
•	Experienced with Windows API, MFC, VB, Notes database design, Notes Mail, Lotus Script, SQL, Notes Pump API, Organizer API, ADK123 Toolkit, SmartSuite, MAPI, VIM, ActiveX, and LSX C++ Toolkit.
•	Authored articles for a trade publication, white papers and IBM Redbooks. I created and gave technical presentations on COM at the World Trade Center, VBits and Lotusphere.


Prior Relevant Work Experience:

01/95 - 03/96 		Corporate Software 	Development Support		Canton, MA		
•	Experience with application design based on a two-tiered client/server and three tiered architectural approach using  ODBC, DAO and ISAM, optimistic/pessimistic locking, keysets, recordsets, transactions, DDL, DML and SQL.
•	Developed Remote OLE Automation servers to demonstrate the advantages of early vs. late binding and in-process server (DLL) vs. out-of-process server (EXE).
•	Enhanced the functionality of Visual Basic by creating Custom Dynamic-Link Libraries and implementing the Windows API (16 and 32 bit). 


Technical Skills:

Languages:	Java, JavaScript, C, C++, MFC, MS Visual C++, COM, ASP, JSP, JSON, REST, JNI, CORBA, XML, XSLT, XHTML, Visual Basic, LotusScript, SQL, UNIX Shell Programming
Software:	Lotus Notes Domino, MSOffice, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, SQL Server, PVCS, SmartSuite, 123, Organizer, Word Pro Apache
Middleware:	Apache, Tomcat, WebSphere, Weblogic, DB2, Oracle 
JavaScript:		Dojo, GridX, Mongo, AngularJS, Express, Node.js, Bootstrap, JQuery, GitHub Projects
Environments:	Window, Linux (Ubuntu), AIX, Solaris, HP, DOS, BlueMix
Repository: 	Git, Jazz, RTC, Rational ClearCase, CVS 
Build: 		Ant, Maven, FireBug, Chrome
Test: 		JUnit, TestNG, Selenium, EasyMock, Jaws
Tools: 		Eclipse, Atom, Sublime 

Patents and Awards:

Formatting rich text data into a JSON array
United States 9021035
Issued April 28, 2015
Formatting rich text data into a JSON array. A parent JSON object can be created within the JSON array. Header information defined as a field of the rich text data can be identified and represented in a root property of the parent JSON object. A plurality of parts of the rich text data can be identified. 

System and Program for Synchronizing Data Elements between Devices
United States 7623551
Issued October 24, 2009
When a current synchronization between a first device and a second device is commenced, a last anchor for the current synchronization to an initialization time of a previous synchronization between the first device and the second device, and a next anchor for the current synchronization is set to an initialization time of the current synchronization. 

System and Method for Optimizing Synchronization
United States US7437484
Issued October 14, 2008
A system and method is provided for optimizing a SyncML slow sync between a proprietary client and server. When a slow sync is detected, the client and server can depart from the normal SyncML protocol and process summary data without having to compare all items on a field-by-field basis.

•	Certified Lotus Professional						Application Developer 
•	UNIX Certificate							University of Massachusetts Lowell
•	RS/6000 System Administration					IBM Global Services

### Authors and Contributors
You can @mention a GitHub username to generate a link to their profile. The resulting `<a>` element will link to the contributor’s GitHub Profile. For example: In 2007, Chris Wanstrath (@defunkt), PJ Hyett (@pjhyett), and Tom Preston-Werner (@mojombo) founded GitHub.

### Support or Contact
Having trouble with Pages? Check out our [documentation](https://help.github.com/pages) or [contact support](https://github.com/contact) and we’ll help you sort it out.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
